about_the_game:
Smoking Gun is a single player, western themed, vertical scroller, shoot 'em up arcade game. As a unaffiliated spiritual successor to a classic 1990's arcade game, Smoking Gun carries on the old gaming style testing your reflexes and accuracy with a new story and modern game engine.

Backstory

Following the mysterious disappearances of members from the notorious Red Rock Raiders gang, the outlaws are hell-bent on vengeance with their sights set on taking Hickstown hostage. As cries for help echo through the Red Rock Valley, the renowned Arizona Ranger, armed with his trusty big iron, rides in to untangle the dire situation confronting the Sheriff and his deputies. Little does he realize the depth and darkness of the abyss that awaits...

Key Features

  • Find and collect gold, ammunition, and power-ups to aid your fight for justice!

  • Unlock new weapons and upgrade your guns to your heart's desire!

  • Be challenged like in retro games of old. Progression saves are limited and the bandits are unforgiving!

  • Fight unique bosses and enemies!

  • Enjoy clean, beautiful western landscapes and visual effects created in the powerful Unreal Engine 5!

  • Listen to satisfying sound effects and high quality western music!

name: Smoking Gun

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10 (x64)
  • Processor: Intel Core i or AMD Ryzen with 4 physical cores
  • Memory: 8 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Geforce GTX 770 or AMD Radeon HD 7970 with at least 4 GB of VRAM
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10 (x64)
  • Processor: Intel Core i or AMD Ryzen with 6 physical cores
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Nvidia GTX 1060 or AMD Radeon 570 with at least 6GB of VRAM
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 2 GB available space

short_description: Smoking Gun is a single player, western themed, vertical scroller, shoot 'em up arcade game. Step into the boots of an Arizona Ranger and fight for justice as ruthless bandits descend upon Hickstown, convinced the lawmen are behind their gang's mysterious disappearances.
